attributeDefinition: Corresponding book and page number for this record in the field notebook/datasheets
Year in which data were collected
Four-letter code of site at which data were collected (nome)
person who handled and banded the bird
definition: First letter and last name (usually) or initials

attributeDefinition: Date of capture
Julian date of capture
Time of capture (24 hr)
Unique ID of bird nest
definition: If the bird was captured on a nest, a unique ID was given to the nest (see Bird_Nests for more information)

attributeDefinition: Name of study plot
definition: Identifier of the study plot on which a bird was captured.  Some names may be duplicated across sites, but are unique within sites.  See Geodata for plot locations.

attributeDefinition: Bird capture location relative to plot boundaries
definition: Indicates whether the nest was within ("in") or outside of ("out") the boundaries of a nest-monitoring study plot.  If not given, assume the nest was located on-plot. This value was determined in the field; see Plot_limit_corr for corrected value determined later with GIS.

attributeDefinition: Latitude of capture location in decimal degrees
Longitude of capture location in decimal degrees
Original unique bird band number
definition: Unique number of the original metal band applied to the bird.  If no metal band was applied but bird is uniquely identifiable by color bands, bird is assigned an arbitrary 3-digit number.  "noband" = bird captured but no bands applied.

attributeDefinition: Current unique bird band number
definition: Unique number of the metal band currently on the bird upon its release.  This may differ from Original_band if the metal band was changed.  If blank, same as Original_band.

attributeDefinition: Four-letter code for the species captured
Sex of the bird, if determined at time of capture.
Method of sexing
Age of bird as recorded in the field.
definition: Age of bird as recorded in the field.

attributeDefinition: Method used to determine bird's age in the field
Status of bird upon completion of handling

Color band(s) applied to upper left leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower left leg below the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to upper right leg (above the tarsal joint); Color band(s) applied to lower right leg below the tarsal joint)
Engraved flag code applied to bird
definition: Three-digit alphanumeric code engraved on the colored leg flag applied to the bird.  Letters are recorded here in lowercase for clarity (e.g. "0" vs. "o"), but engraved in uppercase.  If none given, engraved flag was not applied or code was not recorded.

attributeDefinition: Type of flag applied to bird
definition: Flag is either engraved, plain, or not applied.

attributeDefinition: Whether the bird was captured in a previous year (should be double-checked against other data)
Whether the bird was previously captured in the same year (should be double-checked against other data)
Whether the bird's metal or color bands were changed during this handling event. Not relevant unless bird is a recapture
Bird's previous metal band number
definition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous metal band number (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Band," above, if different).

attributeDefinition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous color combination on the upper left leg, lower left leg, upper right leg, and lower right leg (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Upper_left", "Lower_left", "Upper_right", and "Lower_right" above, if different).
Previous engraved flag id
definition: If any bands were changed, this provides the bird's previous engraved flag code (carried by the bird upon capture and replaced by "Engraved_flag" above, if different).

attributeDefinition: Radio Tag
definition: Whether a radio or satellite tag was applied to the bird (blank = no tag).

attributeDefinition: Identifier of geolocator tag
definition: Whether a light-level geolocator tag was applied to the bird (either the identifier of the tag, or "yes" if a tag was applied but number was not recorded; blank = no tag applied).  Geolocators were applied with a leg band or flag attachment.

attributeDefinition: Time of application
definition: Time at which the geolocator was applied or (for recaptured birds) removed.

attributeDefinition: Method by which bird was captured
definition: method of capture (some described in the ASDN protocal PDF)

attributeDefinition: Stage of breeding cycle at which bird was captured
definition: pre-lay: pre-egg-laying period; laying: egg-laying period as determined by stage of nest or signs that bird is about to or has just laid an egg; inc: incubating eggs; brood: adult attending chicks (at or away from nest); postbreed: bird captured away from a nest during end of summer or fall; unknown: unknown breeding cycle

attributeDefinition: Status of photographic data
definition: Whether one or more photos were taken of the bird in the hand; n=no, y=yes. Sometimes indicates what photos were taken versus not: wing (spread wing feathers), combo (band combination on legs), data (datasheet with corresponding info)

attributeDefinition: Flight Feather Molt Scores - primaries 1-10
Flight Feather Molt Scores - secondaries 1-10
Flight Feather Molt Scores - tertials 1-6
Body molt of head, neck, back, breast, and abdomen
Exposed culmen length
Measured with calipers from tip of culment to notch at back of head, measured to nearest 0.1 mm.  See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Diagonal tarsus, measured with calipers from indentation below the tarsal joint to the indentation above the longest toe, measured to nearest 0.1 mm.  See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Maximum flattened and straightened length of folded wing, measured with wing ruler to nearest mm.  See ASDN_Protocol.pdf for further details.
Weight of bird plus measuring cone or bag, to nearest 0.1 g, measured with hanging Pesola scale
Weight of cone or bag in which bird was weighed
Net weight of bird (Weight - Bag_wt) to nearest 0.1 g
Body fat score
Estimated blood volume collected based on number and percent of capillary tubes filled. y = blood taken but not recorded; trace = unmeasurably small amount taken.
Blood test for malaria
Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for malaria test.
definition: EDTA (anti-coagulant), heparin (heparinized anti-coagulant), or unknown. Numbers are occasionally provided but these are probably a data entry error.

attributeDefinition: Type of blood preservative used for malaria sample.
definition: RNAlater, Lysis (Queen's Lysis Buffer), or unknown.

attributeDefinition: Blood collected for genetic sampling
Amount of blood taken for genetic sample
Type of preservative for genetic blood sample
Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for genetic blood sample.
definition: EDTA, heparin, plain (no anti-coagulant), hematocrit (no preservative, stored in capillary tube with ends capped), or unknown

attributeDefinition: Blood collected for methyl mercury testing
Amount of blood (Âµl) taken for methyl mercury testing
Type of capillary tube used to collect sample for methyl mercury testing
Whether feathers were collected for the ASDN archive
Which feathers were collected for ASDN archive
Whether 3-5 breast feathers were collected for moss dispersal side-project
Whether fecal sample was collected (passive sampling by placing bird in box for few minutes) for gut microbiota side-project.
What type of preservative was used for fecal sample
Whether cloaca was swabbed for avian influenza testing
Avian influenza sample number if applicable
definition: Avian influenza sample number if applicable

attributeDefinition: Type of sample taken for avian influenca, if applicable.
Whether a blood plasma sample was taken for malaria testing.
Whether a red blood cell sample was taken for malaria testing.
Type of preservative for malaria red blood cell sample
Whether a blood sample was taken for RNALater analysis
Type of capillary tube used to collect RNALater blood sample
definition: heparin, plain (no anti-coagulant), blank = no sample collected

attributeDefinition: Preservative
definition: Preservative used for other types of blood samples

attributeDefinition: Type of capillary tube used to store blood sample
definition: EDTA, plain, blank = no sample collected

attributeDefinition: Whether a blood sample was taken for methyl mercury testing.
Label/identifier of egg or chick
definition: Label/identifier of egg or chick from a particular nest (1 through 4).

attributeDefinition: Whether a tissue sample was taken from a chick.
Type of tissue sample taken from chick, if applicable.
definition: Type of tissue sample taken from chick, if applicable. "Specimen" indicates whole chick was preserved

attributeDefinition: Additional comments
definition: Any further field or data-management notes relevant to this record.  "ELW note" indicates data-management comment added by Emily Weiser.

attributeDefinition: Corrected plot limit values calculated in GIS
definition: Corrected "Plot_limit"" GIS calculations: indicates whether the bird was captured within (in) or outside (out) of the boundaries of a nest monitoring study plot. If not given, assume the bird was captured on-plot.
